alert.note: Alert for Keith; Lincoln; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Perkins, eastern Keith and northwestern Lincoln Counties through 915 PM CDT/815 PM MDT/... At 830 PM CDT/730 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Paxton to near Grant. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grant, Sutherland, Paxton, Madrid, Sarben, Roscoe, Big Bald Hill, Wild Horse Spring, Coker, Nevens and Broganville. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 63 and 77. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 131 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for southwestern Nebraska.
